attributes.action: Allow funding for people in the entertainment industry.
attributes.additional_details: An unfair balance and biased opinion that performers such as dancers, singers, bands etc. who receive money from the public attending shows are now receiving nothing whereas the most of the uk population are receiving furlough. As good as 80% of wages being payed for people who are employed, there’s nothing been given to people who perform and earned money from making people happy and enjoy their time when spectating.
attributes.background: Fund artists and entertainers in the uk who are missing out on performing in-front of crowds who don’t work in hospitality or customer service so are not receiving any income such as furlough like most UK citizens.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332353

Self-employed entertainers may be eligible for the Government's Self-Employment Income Support Scheme. If you want the Government to remove the cap on income for claiming from this scheme you might like to sign the following petition:

Remove the £50,000 cap and extend the tax return deadline for the SEISS: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551833
